title: IBM Cloud® Databases for MongoDB docs
introduction: MongoDB is a JSON document store with a rich query and aggregation framework.

section_recommended.title: Getting Started
section_recommended.description: A brief tutorial to introduce using an IBM Cloud® Databases for MongoDB deployment.

section_recommended.title: Setting the Admin Password
section_recommended.description: The IBM Cloud® Databases for MongoDB service is provisioned with a admin user. You must set the admin password before you use it to connect.

section_recommended.title: Getting Connection Strings
section_recommended.description: To connect to IBM Cloud® Databases for MongoDB, you need some users and connection strings.

tiles.title: Point-in-time Recovery
tiles.description: IBM Cloud® Databases for MongoDB Enterprise Edition offers PITR using any timestamp greater than the earliest available recovery point.

tiles.title: Deploying and Connecting an IBM Cloud® Databases Instance Tutorial
tiles.description: This tutorial guides you through the process of deploying a Cloud Databases instance and connecting it to a web front end by creating a webpage that allows visitors to input a word and its definition. These values are then stored in a database running on Cloud Databases. You install the database infrastructure by using Terraform and your web application uses the popular Express framework. The application can then be run locally, or by using Docker.

tiles.title: Protecting IBM Cloud® Databases for MongoDB resources with context-based restrictions
tiles.description: Context-based restrictions (CBR) give account owners and administrators the ability to define and enforce access restrictions for IBM Cloud® resources based on the context of access requests. Access to Cloud Databases resources can be controlled with CBR and identity and access management (IAM) policies.
